title: ICE: Type parameter out of range when substituting

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
When running `cargo test` on [this code](https://fuchsia-review.googlesource.com/c/garnet/+/160698/18) (in particular, patch set 18), I get the following error:

```text
error: internal compiler error: librustc/ty/subst.rs:479: Type parameter `HwAddr/#1` (HwAddr/1) out of range when substituting (root type=Some(wire::arp::ArpBody<HwAddr, ProtoAddr>)) substs=[wire::arp::ArpBody<HwAddr, ProtoAddr>]
```

<details>
<summary>Thread stack and query stack:</summary>

```text
thread 'main' panicked at 'Box<Any>', librustc_errors/lib.rs:499:9
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace

query stack during panic:
#0 [const_eval] const-evaluating `<wire::arp::ArpPacket<B, HwAddr, ProtoAddr>>::PACKET_LEN`
#1 [optimized_mir] processing `<wire::arp::ArpPacket<&'a mut [u8], HwAddr, ProtoAddr>>::serialize`
#2 [collect_and_partition_mono_items] collect_and_partition_mono_items
end of query stack
```

</details>

## Misc

- `rustc 1.28.0-nightly (a805a2a5e 2018-06-10) running on x86_64-apple-darwin`
- `compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental`
